name: BeagleBone Black
instructions:
Use dd or Pi Filler software to burn the .img to your SD card.
Warning! This step is dangerous. You can see a full description of this process here.
Safely eject the freshly burnt SD card and insert into the BeagleBone Black.
Connect your device to the internet.
Power up the BBB while holding down the small button near the SD slot. You need to keep it pressed until the blue LEDs start flashing wildly.

osx:
You need either Homebrew or MacPorts installed on your system.
For Homebrew - run the following to install dfu-util:
brew install dfu-util
For MacPorts - run the following to install dfu-util:
sudo port install dfu-util
Unplug the Intel Edison board from your system.
Unzip the downloaded Device OS file.

Execute the following from the unzipped directory:
sudo ./flashall.sh

Plug the Intel Edison as per the instructions on your terminal.
You can check the progress of the provisioning on your terminal.
windows: Install Windows drivers for Edison from here
Unplug the Intel Edison board from your system.
Unzip the downloaded Device OS file.

Open a terminal with administrative privileges and execute the following from the unzipped directory:
flashall.bat

Plug the Intel Edison as per the instructions on your terminal.
You can check the progress of the provisioning on your terminal.
linux:
Install dfu-util from your distributions repos. For example, for Ubuntu:
apt-get install dfu-util
Unplug the Intel Edison board from your system.
Unzip the downloaded Device OS file.

Execute the following from the unzipped directory:
sudo ./flashall.sh

Plug the Intel Edison as per the instructions on your terminal.
You can check the progress of the provisioning on your terminal.
